alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 6:17PM MDT until May 24 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Quay County in east central New Mexico... Northeastern Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 617 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near San Jon, or 18 miles east of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... San Jon, Grady, Glenrio, Broadview, Wheatland, Bellview and Bard. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 352 and 373. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
